decks.notes: The main goal of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creature cards, using cards like Entomb and Grief, and then bring them back into play using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. By combining efficient mana acceleration and disruption spells like Daze and Force of Will, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The inclusion of counterspells like Daze and Brainstorm ensures that the deck can protect its game plan while smoothly executing its combo strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures such as Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, and then using reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to cheat them into play. It also includes disruptive cards like Grief and Daze to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to rapidly overwhelm the opponent with threats and efficient disruption, creating a fast-paced and challenging gameplay experience.

The deck focuses on generating a high storm count to cast powerful spells such as Tendrils of Agony and Burning Wish. By using cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Dark Ritual to generate mana quickly, along with draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to find key pieces, the deck aims to storm off and win the game in a single turn. Veil of Summer offers protection against disruption, while Gaea's Will and Echo of Eons provide extra resources and the ability to reset the board. The goal is to assemble the pieces for a lethal storm turn as quickly and efficiently as possible.

The deck focuses on using fast mana sources and cantrips to quickly build up storm count and mana to cast a game-ending Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam. It also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Veil of Summer to protect the combo pieces. The Wishclaw Talisman serves as a tutor for key combo pieces, while Gaea's Will can provide a reset if needed. The deck aims to win the game in a single turn through a high storm count and efficient use of resources.

The main concept of this deck is to have a strong control over the game by utilizing a variety of powerful spells and creatures. The deck focuses on using cards like Force of Will and Force of Negation to counter opponent's spells, while also having removal spells like Swords to Plowshares to deal with threats. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding help control the board, while cards like Ponder and Brainstorm allow for card selection and manipulation. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Scion of Draco to provide threats and close out the game.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying threats like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal spells. The deck aims to control the battlefield by getting ahead on tempo and using versatile creatures like Orcish Bowmasters to maintain board presence. Mishra's Bauble helps generate card advantage while cards like Lightning Bolt and Daze provide additional ways to deal with opposing threats. The mana base is optimized for consistent access to different colors of mana to support the diverse spell requirements of the deck.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb, Grief, and Reanimate, then bringing them back onto the battlefield for little cost with cards like Animate Dead and Archon of Cruelty. With disruption and protection spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Brainstorm, the deck aims to outpace and overwhelm the opponent by efficiently reanimating threats while controlling the board. The key strategy is to create explosive plays by combining graveyard manipulation with powerful reanimation spells to quickly close out the game.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, and then bringing them back into play with cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. It also includes disruption spells like Brainstorm, Daze, and Force of Will to protect the combo and control the opponent's moves. With a balance of control elements and explosive reanimation plays, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures while disrupting their game plan.

This Mono Red Combo deck focuses on generating fast mana with cards like Grim Monolith and Lotus Petal to cast powerful spells like Echo of Eons and Galvanic Relay. The deck leverages Burning Wish to search for important combo pieces and uses cards like Defense Grid to protect its game plan. By playing cards like Rite of Flame and Lion's Eye Diamond, this deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with explosive plays, ultimately leading to a swift victory against any opponent in the Legacy format.

The main concept of this Dimir Aggro deck is to quickly control the board with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Grief, while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Force of Will and Daze. The deck aims to apply pressure with efficient threats like Murktide Regent and Orcish Bowmasters, while also utilizing disruptive spells like Snuff Out and Drown in the Loch to maintain tempo. Additionally, the deck includes powerful reanimation spells like Reanimate to bring back key creatures from the graveyard for additional value. The deck is designed to be fast, disruptive, and versatile in its approach to winning the game.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the cards needed to combo off with Doomsday and win the game by either using Thassa's Oracle or Lion's Eye Diamond. The deck includes a variety of fast mana sources, card draw spells, and disruption to help the player find and protect their combo pieces. Personal Tutor is used to search for Doomsday, while cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help with card selection. The goal is to efficiently set up the Doomsday pile and win the game in a single turn.

The primary strategy of this deck is to rapidly swarm the battlefield with Goblins and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. By utilizing cards like Muxus, Goblin Grandee and Goblin Rabblemaster, the deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence and deal heavy damage to the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Chalice of the Void and Shatterskull Smashing provides additional control and removal options to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also benefits from mana acceleration provided by cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide to power out threats early on.

The main concept of this Goblins aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive swarm of Goblin creatures. By utilizing cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox for fast mana acceleration, along with high-value Goblins like Goblin Ringleader and Muxus, Goblin Grandee, the deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence and deal damage before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Shatterskull Smashing and City of Traitors also provides additional removal and mana options to keep the pressure on the opponent.

The key concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to maintain tempo and pressure on the opponent by playing efficient threats like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler while disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also utilizes cards like Lightning Bolt and Orcish Bowmasters to deal with opposing creatures, while Mishra's Bauble and Ponder help to dig for key cards. The manabase is designed to support the deck's aggressive game plan with fetch lands and dual lands, while Wasteland helps to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The main focus of this deck is to apply constant pressure on the opponent by playing aggressive creatures like Archon of Emeria and Seasoned Dungeoneer. The deck also looks to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Chalice of the Void and Anointed Peacekeeper. Utilizing cards like Chrome Mox and Lotus Petal for fast mana acceleration, the deck aims to gain the upper hand in the game and maintain control. With a mixture of powerful creatures and disruptive spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on using lands as resources to control the game, utilizing cards like Crop Rotation, Life from the Loam, and Exploration to generate value and mana. It aims to lock down the opponent with Sphere of Resistance while assembling powerful land-based combos like Thespian's Stage + Dark Depths to create a 20/20 indestructible creature. The deck also has tools like Ghost Quarter, Maze of Ith, and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, it seeks to grind out the opponent with powerful land synergies and resource denial.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while gradually gaining control over the game through removal spells, counters, and powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Tarmogoyf. By utilizing a combination of card advantage, efficient removal, and versatile threats, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in the long run. The mana base is built to support the control elements of the deck while still providing access to the necessary colors for its spells. In essence, this deck seeks to control the game's pace and outcome through disruption and smart decision-making.

The main concept of this deck is to maintain control over the game by utilizing a combination of powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Orcish Bowmasters, along with a suite of disruptive spells like Force of Will, Daze, and Thoughtseize. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while deploying threats of its own, gradually taking over the game and grinding out a win. In addition, the deck utilizes cards like Misty Rainforest and Wasteland to ensure mana efficiency and control the pace of the game.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal, and disruption spells. It aims to control the board and prevent the opponent from executing their strategy effectively. The deck includes a mix of powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Leovold, Emissary of Trest, along with versatile spells like Brainstorm and Force of Will. By controlling the game and outmaneuvering the opponent, this deck seeks to grind out a victory through attrition and superior decision-making.

This deck aims to assemble the Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor combo to quickly mill the library, and then use Dread Return to bring back Thassa's Oracle for the win. It includes protection spells like Force of Will and Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt opponents' game plans, along with card selection and tutor effects like Brainstorm and Ponder. The land base includes fetch lands and dual lands for consistency. The key strategy is to combo off quickly while disrupting the opponent's strategy with timely counter spells and disruptive creatures like Narcomoeba.

This Doomsday Combo deck focuses on quickly assembling the cards needed to win the game in a single turn. By utilizing cards like Thassa's Oracle and Lion's Eye Diamond, the deck aims to control the game and set up a game-winning Doomsday pile. The deck uses efficient mana sources like Lotus Petal and rituals to enable explosive turns and dig for key combo pieces with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder. With multiple ways to protect the combo with Force of Will and Daze, this deck is all about setting up the perfect sequence of cards to secure victory in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying threats like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Daze and Force of Will. By utilizing aggressive creatures and efficient spells like Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to apply pressure and close out the game as quickly as possible. Additionally, cards like Stifle and Wasteland help to disrupt the opponent's mana base, giving the deck an advantage in the early game. Overall, the deck is designed to be proactive and aggressive, aiming to win before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, using powerful creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Delver of Secrets, and Murktide Regent to quickly pressure the opponent. Support cards like Brainstorm, Daze, and Force of Will help to protect and further the aggressive strategy. Orcish Bowmasters provide additional creature removal, while cards like Lightning Bolt and Stifle offer versatile answers to threats. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color composition, with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands for consistency and mana fixing.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Delver of Secrets, backed up by disruption in the form of Daze and Force of Will. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Orcish Bowmasters while pressuring the opponent's life total. The inclusion of cards like Mishra's Bauble and Brainstorm helps to smooth out draws and ensure efficient use of resources. The deck's mana base includes fetch lands and dual lands to support its color requirements and maximize consistency.

This aggressive deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence and disrupting your opponent's game plan by taxing their resources with cards like Chalice of the Void and Archon of Emeria. By using quick mana generation and efficient creatures like Seasoned Dungeoneer and Solitude, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game. The inclusion of cards like Chrome Mox and Lotus Petal allow for explosive starts, while the land base and sideboard options provide flexibility and resilience against a variety of strategies.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through lands manipulation, utilizing cards like Life from the Loam and Exploration to maximize land drops and graveyard recursion. The key strategy involves using Urza's Saga to search for powerful artifacts and lands like The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale and Dark Depths, while disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port. By creating a resource advantage and locking down the opponent's options, the deck aims to slowly grind out a win through a combination of land destruction, control elements, and powerful land synergies.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 Combo-Painter deck focuses on utilizing cards like Goblin Welder and Painter's Servant to set up a powerful combo with Grindstone, allowing the player to mill their opponent's deck and win the game. The deck also includes disruption elements like Pyroblast and Ensnaring Bridge to control the board and protect the combo. With efficient mana acceleration from cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb, this deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent before they can set up their own game plan.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly through cards like Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond to cast powerful spells like Tendrils of Agony or Galvanic Relay multiple times in a single turn, aiming to create a storm count high enough to win the game in one explosive turn. The deck also utilizes cards like Echo of Eons and Gaea's Will to refill the hand and continue the combo. The inclusion of Burning Wish allows for flexibility and access to a wide range of sideboard options to adapt to different matchups.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, then using spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield for a powerful and swift victory. The deck also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its combo pieces, along with card draw and library manipulation cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency in executing the combo. The mana base is streamlined to support the deck's strategy and disrupt opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland.

The main focus of the deck is to quickly get powerful creatures into the graveyard, using cards like Entomb and Grief, and then bring them back to the battlefield with Reanimate and Animate Dead. This combo strategy allows the player to cheat creatures into play without paying their mana costs, giving them a significant advantage over their opponent. The deck also includes disruption cards like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo pieces, as well as card draw and deck manipulation spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the necessary pieces quickly.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to quickly bring back huge threats like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. With plenty of disruption in the form of Grief and counter spells like Force of Will and Daze, the deck aims to disrupt opponents while efficiently assembling its combo pieces. The mana base includes fetch lands and Wasteland to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors and disrupt opponent's mana bases. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast and powerful reanimation threats.
